=== About Me ===

I've been tinkering with Ubuntu since 9.10 and using it full time since 11.04. I enjoy programming and scripting as a hobby, although I'm not very good at either. Amateur CLI geek. I <3 Unity.

I also have <nowiki>[[http://keybase.io|keybase.io]]</nowiki> invites!

=== Contributions ===

<nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/users/44179/seth|{{http://askubuntu.com/users/flair/44179.png}}]]</nowiki>  

I'm an elected Moderator (â™¦) on Ask Ubuntu and user #53 by reputation (17.8k at time of writing). Some of my top answers include:  

* <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/questions/260510/how-do-i-turn-on-workspaces-why-do-i-only-have-one-workspace/287408#287408|How do I enable workspaces?]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/questions/420981/how-do-i-save-terminal-output-to-a-file/420983#420983|How do I save terminal output to a file?]]</nowiki>  

* <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/questions/236381/what-is-apparmor/236397#236397| What is AppArmor?]]</nowiki>  

* <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/questions/512770/what-is-use-of-command-command/538818#538818| What is the use of the `command` command?]]</nowiki>

When I'm not on Ask Ubuntu answering questions, helping people in <nowiki>[[http://chat.stackexchange.com/?tab=site&host=askubuntu.com|chat]]</nowiki>, or doing janitorial work, I maintain the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~sethj/+archive/ubuntu/silentcast|Silentcast PPA]]</nowiki>, help out the Q/A team with ISO and package testing and more recently some bug management in the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BigDesktopBugScrub| Big Desktop Bug Scrub]]</nowiki> where I've processed over 50 bugs (so far).  

I've submitted 2 patches to packages in Ubuntu (hopefully with more to come!).

I have <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~sethj/+codesofconduct|signed]]</nowiki> the Ubuntu Code of Conduct.

=== Future Goals ===

==== Short term: ====

* Do more bug work! Right now any I manage to do is on a very ''make'' time for it approach due to school. I'm hoping to make some schedule changes soon that will allow me to devote more time to it.
 
* Do more testing! I have a bigger HDD now so I can devote a space just for the latest daily image which will makes things 10 times easier.

* Fix more bugs! Right now I'm looking at joining the papercuts team which seems like a good way to do that.

==== Long term: ====

* Do more packaging.

* Get involved in LoCo. No car currently so until then..

* I'd like to write software for Ubuntu Touch some day..

And somewhere in between is finish the Python app I am working on. I'm also attempting to fix the <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/unity/+bug/1445595| empty trash bug]]</nowiki> in Unity.
